basics.name: Jeano Ermitaño
basics.summary: Master of Information Systems and ICT Program Head with over 5 years of experience leading 20 faculty members and 1000+ students, now applying leadership and technical expertise to ensure organizational security.

work.name: STI College Las Piñas
work.summary: Managed ICT-related degree programs with a team of 20 faculty members
highlights: Ensured compliance to curriculum of BSIT, BSCS, BSCPE, and BMMA programs.
Conducted regular department meetings similar to Agile restrospectives.
Trained faculty members during INSET and onboarding on the use of teacher applications.
Evaluated faculty member performance though mentoring, giving coaching sessions and appraisals.
Interviewed candidates for teaching positions and recommended applicants for hiring
Presented concerns, goals, and achievements of the department to senior management during meetings.
Managed class schedules of both faculty members and students.
Resolved concerns of faculty members such as classroom management, courseware usage, and grading.
Prepared activity proposals, budget requests, and liquidation of department events.
Participated in student engagement such as enrollment and orientation.
Collaborated with the Admission Office during student acquisition activities.
Mediated escalation of student concerns with the Guidance Office.
Coordinated with the MIS department to recommend, procure, and configure hardware and software.
Assessed acceptability of BSIT and BSCS capstone projects during thesis defense.
Identified and disclosed vulnerabilities regarding information systems using TTP framework.
Automated tasks such as generation of exam attendance sheet.
Created informative faculty guides and supplementary student learning materials.
Attended networking opportunities within STI and externally with partner organizations.

work.name: Personiv
work.summary: Created professional websites while consistently meeting production requirements.
highlights: Built new and modified existing websites using Duda, Thryv.
Maintained SLA of 4 hours for new website builds, and 1 hour for modifications.
Migrated legacy websites to the currently supported platform.
Used Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator to create or revise website assets.
Audited SEO and website performance using Google Lighthouse.
Tracked website status in Google Sheets, SalesForce, and Atlassian JIRA.
Participated in employee welfare activities such as mural painting, bay design and prop making.
Went to Personiv Gurugram in India as part of two-man specialist team tasked to oversee usage of new design tool.

education.institution: University of the Philippines Open University
courses: Capstone Project Title: Go Guro Mobile Application Built with Android and Firebase

education.institution: De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde
education.studyType: Bachelor of Science in Information Systems
courses: Capstone Project Title: Benilde Service Rating System

awards.title: GPS Award - Student's Choice Awards
awards.summary: The STI Student's Choice Awards celebrate outstanding educators selected by students for their inspiring passion and impactful teaching. The GPS Award is given to a teacher who is devoted to guiding and mentoring students in achieving their goals.

certificates.name: Introduction to Incident Command System, ICS-100
Google Cloud Digital Leader Training Specialization
Image Management and Elastic Volume Service

skills.name: Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR)
keywords: Network Forensics: Packet-level traffic analysis using Wireshark.
Malware Analysis: Reverse engineering malware with OllyDbg and ILSpy.
Incident Management: Coordinating threat response using ICS-100 and Cyber Kill Chain.

skills.name: Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing (VAPT)
keywords: Reconnaissance: Discovery and enumeration using Nmap, Shodan, and OSINT tools.
Exploitation: Validating vulnerabilities with Burp Suite and Metasploit.
Documentation: Authoring technical reports using TTP mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

skills.name: Security Operations (SecOps)
keywords: Detection: Managing Wazuh SIEM/XDR for endpoint monitoring.
Triage: Analyzing threats in sandboxed Windows/Ubuntu environments.
Resilience: Updating SOAR playbooks and coordinating recovery procedures.

skills.name: Infrastructure Security and Engineering
keywords: Secure Development: Building applications in Java and C# following SDLC and security practices.
Systems Design: Requirements analysis, tracking, and modeling using UML.
Data Protection: Applying fundamental cryptography and infrastructure hardening.

skills.name: Strategic Leadership
keywords: Result-Oriented: Led 20 faculty members to deliver ICT curricula to over 1000 students.
Stakeholder Management: Effectively communicated needs between customers (students, parents) and operations (instructors, administrators).
Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC): Familiarity with NIST, ISO 27001, and GDPR.

skills.name: Security Education
keywords: Security Awareness: Promoted departmental cyber-hygiene and company-wide safety initiatives.
Certification Mentorship: Coached 3 students to pass their Ethical Hacking Essentials (EHE) Certification exam.
Technical Instruction: Taught cybersecurity across multi-disciplinary degree programs: BSIT, BSCS, BSCPE, and BSAIS.
